com.topright.roboticon

Class PlotTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topright.roboticon.PlotTestCase

  • public class PlotTestCase
extends java.lang.Object
    Test case for the Plot class
    Author:
    Ben

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlotTestCase() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setup()
      Runs before every test, creates a new plot that specialises in producing ore and a mocked player object
      void testCreatePlotEnergySecialismCorrect()
      Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot that is supposed to specialise in energy production does in fact specialise in energy production
      void testCreatePlotNoPlayer()
      Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot does not have an associated player (i.e.
      void testCreatePlotNoRoboticon()
      Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot does not yet have a roboticon on it
      void testCreatePlotNotAcquired()
      Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot has not yet been acquired
      void testCreatePlotNullRoboticon()
      Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot does not yet have a roboticon on it, by calling its getRoboticon method and ensuring that it returns null
      void testCreatePlotOreSpecialismCorrect()
      Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot that is supposed to specialise in ore production does in fact specialise in ore production
      void testProduceEnergyPlotEnergyRoboticonProduce2Energy()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an energy roboticon on it, it will produce 2 energy for its player
      void testProduceEnergyPlotEnergyRoboticonProduceNoOre()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an energy roboticon on it, it will produce 0 ore for its player
      void testProduceEnergyPlotOreRoboticonProduce1Ore()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an ore roboticon on it, it will produce 1 ore for its player
      void testProduceEnergyPlotOreRoboticonProduceNoEnergy()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an ore roboticon on it, it will produce 0 energy for its player
      void testProduceNoPlayerEnergyPlot()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in energy) when the plot hasn't got a player on it, an exception won't be thrown
      void testProduceNoPlayerOrePlot()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in ore) when the plot hasn't got a player on it, an exception won't be thrown
      void testProduceNoRoboticonEnergyPlot()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in energy) when the plot hasn't got a roboticon on it, it wont produce any resources for the player
      void testProduceNoRoboticonOrePlot()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in ore) when the plot hasn't got a roboticon on it, it wont produce any resources for the player
      void testProduceOrePlotEnergyRoboticonProduce1Energy()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in ore when the plot has an energy roboticon on it, it will produce 1 energy for its player
      void testProduceOrePlotEnergyRoboticonProduceNoOre()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in ore when the plot has an energy roboticon on it, it will produce 0 ore for its player
      void testProduceOrePlotOreRoboticonProduce2Ore()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in ore production when the plot has an ore roboticon on it, it will produce 2 ore for its player
      void testProduceOrePlotOreRoboticonProduceNoEnergy()
      Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in ore when the plot has an ore roboticon on it, it will produce 0 energy for its player
      void testSetPlayerAlreadyAcquiredNewPlayer()
      Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has been acquired and this method is called and a new player tries to acquire the plot an exception is thrown
      void testSetPlayerAlreadyAcquiredSamePlayer()
      Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has been acquired and this method is called and the same player tries to acquire the plot again an exception is thrown
      void testSetPlayerCurrentlyNoPlayerCorrectPlayer()
      Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has not yet been acquired (does not yet have a player) and this method is called the plots player attribute is set correctly
      void testSetPlayerCurrentlyNoPlayerHasBeenAcquired()
      Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has not yet been acquired (does not yet have a player) and this method is called that afterwards the plot will register as being acquired

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Runs before every test, creates a new plot that specialises in producing ore and a mocked player object

      • testCreatePlotNoPlayer

        public void testCreatePlotNoPlayer()
        Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot does not have an associated player (i.e. no player owns it)

      • testCreatePlotNotAcquired

        public void testCreatePlotNotAcquired()
        Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot has not yet been acquired

      • testCreatePlotOreSpecialismCorrect

        public void testCreatePlotOreSpecialismCorrect()
        Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot that is supposed to specialise in ore production does in fact specialise in ore production

      • testCreatePlotEnergySecialismCorrect

        public void testCreatePlotEnergySecialismCorrect()
        Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot that is supposed to specialise in energy production does in fact specialise in energy production

      • testCreatePlotNullRoboticon

        public void testCreatePlotNullRoboticon()
        Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot does not yet have a roboticon on it, by calling its getRoboticon method and ensuring that it returns null

      • testCreatePlotNoRoboticon

        public void testCreatePlotNoRoboticon()
        Tests Plot.Plot(PlotSpecialism) and ensures that a newly created plot does not yet have a roboticon on it

      • testSetPlayerCurrentlyNoPlayerCorrectPlayer

        public void testSetPlayerCurrentlyNoPlayerCorrectPlayer()
        Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has not yet been acquired (does not yet have a player) and this method is called the plots player attribute is set correctly

      • testSetPlayerCurrentlyNoPlayerHasBeenAcquired

        public void testSetPlayerCurrentlyNoPlayerHasBeenAcquired()
        Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has not yet been acquired (does not yet have a player) and this method is called that afterwards the plot will register as being acquired

      • testSetPlayerAlreadyAcquiredNewPlayer

        public void testSetPlayerAlreadyAcquiredNewPlayer()
        Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has been acquired and this method is called and a new player tries to acquire the plot an exception is thrown

      • testSetPlayerAlreadyAcquiredSamePlayer

        public void testSetPlayerAlreadyAcquiredSamePlayer()
        Tests Plot.setPlayer(Player) ensures that when a plot has been acquired and this method is called and the same player tries to acquire the plot again an exception is thrown

      • testProduceNoRoboticonOrePlot

        public void testProduceNoRoboticonOrePlot()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in ore) when the plot hasn't got a roboticon on it, it wont produce any resources for the player

      • testProduceNoRoboticonEnergyPlot

        public void testProduceNoRoboticonEnergyPlot()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in energy) when the plot hasn't got a roboticon on it, it wont produce any resources for the player

      • testProduceNoPlayerEnergyPlot

        public void testProduceNoPlayerEnergyPlot()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in energy) when the plot hasn't got a player on it, an exception won't be thrown

      • testProduceNoPlayerOrePlot

        public void testProduceNoPlayerOrePlot()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that (for a plot specialising in ore) when the plot hasn't got a player on it, an exception won't be thrown

      • testProduceEnergyPlotEnergyRoboticonProduce2Energy

        public void testProduceEnergyPlotEnergyRoboticonProduce2Energy()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an energy roboticon on it, it will produce 2 energy for its player

      • testProduceEnergyPlotEnergyRoboticonProduceNoOre

        public void testProduceEnergyPlotEnergyRoboticonProduceNoOre()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an energy roboticon on it, it will produce 0 ore for its player

      • testProduceEnergyPlotOreRoboticonProduce1Ore

        public void testProduceEnergyPlotOreRoboticonProduce1Ore()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an ore roboticon on it, it will produce 1 ore for its player

      • testProduceEnergyPlotOreRoboticonProduceNoEnergy

        public void testProduceEnergyPlotOreRoboticonProduceNoEnergy()
        Tests Plot.produce() ensure that for a plot specialising in energy production when the plot has an ore roboticon on it, it will produce 0 energy for its player
